title.narrative: 215 COMMUNICATION

description.narrative: ROSA, through effective support to COs and strategic engagement with partners, contribute to winning support for the cause of children from decision makers and the wider public particularly on key priority issues in the region., which contributes to Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Comprehensive, sustainable and enabling environment that leaves no child behind is supported by policies, programmes, strategies, budgets and actions of Governments, regional institutions, private sector, media, financial institutions, UN and UNICEF country programmes in South Asia, in development and humanitarian contexts.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: ROSA, through effective support to COs and strategic engagement with partners, contribute to winning support for the cause ofchildren from decision makers and the wider public particularly on key priority issues in the region.

description.narrative: In 2021, ROSA’s communication section deftly and boldly navigated two historical crises with significant reputational risks and stakes for the organization: the COVID-19 second wave and the Afghanistan takeover. Instant regional positioning & thought leadership on these crises led to soaring media coverage, with over 8000 articles mentioning UNICEF. ROSA’s website doubled its traffic to 1.9 million unique views, showing growing trust in the organization. Digital growth increased 17% and ROSA launched a highly successful youth-focused TikTok channel. The section strategically leveraged key advocacy moments including back to school, COP26 and UNICEF75 to push decision-makers on increased action for children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:27/12/2021
